lexUnit.name: evade.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: escape or avoid, especially by guile or trickery

sentence.text: If only she had been able to evade her pursuer sooner .
If they are accurate , the new Foxbats can not only evade our missiles , they can attain the very top level of the stratosphere , and maintain a speed which is only marginally sub-orbital .

On another occasion she climbed over dustbins and went through the fire exit of a Knightsbridge store , while once she and Carolyn abandoned her car and jumped on a red double decker bus to evade photographers .
Hooligans often take care to evade police escorts and to slip into rival territories unobserved .
Attempts by police to prevent protesters from other parts of the country from reaching the city lead to the death of a student on May 20 as he sought to evade a police cordon .
Remaining silent may allow fish to evade these predators , but it is no defence against sharks and barracudas .
Possums and some other creatures evade predators by playing dead .
I evaded her eyes .
He evaded Mark 's eyes .
The alien bird evaded her with ease .
She had n't simply evaded him ; she 'd evaded him each time with an ease that had left him looking like a fool .
For over a week , buffalo and lion evaded us .
And yet the parasite evaded it . "

The contradictions between corporate goal-achieving behaviour and each of these environmental uncertainties creates a strong strain towards innovative behaviour which can stretch over the spectrum law abiding -- law avoiding -- law evading -- law breaking .
Flanagan 's run on the left caught out Wright and his cross evaded the Aberdeen defence before finding Henry who nodded the ball over the line from inside the six-yard box .
If you 're small and the thing you evade is big ( have you ever had this dream ? ) , then the only place to hide is a place where the big thing ca n't fit .
Howard evaded the FBI and managed to escape to Russia but Pelton was arrested and sentenced to life imprisonment in 1986 .
Basinger evaded reporters and cameramen as she left the courthouse Wednesday , leaving by a sidedoor and rushing off in a black sedan .
And 14 minutes later , the cool Marwood foxed Wigan by switching the ball to the blindside where winger Paul Penrice evaded Martin Offiah to score in the corner .
Two more made a futile dive for Okoye 's legs at the five and he evaded a final defender at the goal-line .
He runs too upright , relies too much on sheer strength instead of evading defenders , and so takes too many hits .
However , Cardiff 's backs were not quick enough collectively to evade the home side 's conscientious cover .
He asks that I go secretly and after dark -- near the eleventh hour , he says -- thus to evade the guards who are wont to fall asleep at that time ! "
Having evaded the other Fiats , Taylour headed for the carrier with his wounded TAG , where only prompt and skilful action by the ` Ark 's , surgeon prevented the loss of Howard 's leg .
Foals who have learnt to evade bot-flies in such a way , will continue to do so as adult horses if they have access to shelter .
They could n't evade the most experienced sub-hunters in the world , not for ever .
It would be a mad gamble of course , to launch an invasion from a European port and hope to evade the British fleet .
Colour flooded her face as she tried to struggle to her feet , desperate to evade the hand that was stretched towards her .
The truth is being evaded by ? `
His softened looks hardened , but she evaded his hands and went headlong down the stairs , stopping only momentarily to brush the straw from her trousers and fasten her blouse with shaking fingers .
At that point he was attacked by twelve Bf109s , but evaded and got in a good burst at one that overshot him .
At 8,000 feet numerous Bf109s attacked but were evaded in cloud , and the section broke up .
West German officials said they understood the trains would be sealed from the inside , and would take roundabout routes to evade jumpers-on .
` Leave me alone ! " she screamed when her efforts to evade him proved useless and a pair of iron hands fastened on her arms .
By evading him earlier that morning she 'd played into his hands , at the same time both increasing his suspicions and giving him the best part of the day to allay them .
He pulled her into his arms , giving her no chance to try to evade him as he held her tightly against the solid strength of his body .
He tried to kiss her , but she evaded him in a half-angry , half-flirtatious way , so they were in the middle of a clumsy clinch when Lucaroni walked in .
But it evaded him .
She had n't simply evaded him ; she 'd evaded him each time with an ease that had left him looking like a fool .
Over the next two days she continued to evade him .
A He111 appeared over the Fleet soon after the Hurricanes had departed and this was chased by the Fulmar patrol but managed to evade them and escape .
Neither Fedorov nor the man who had evaded them the other night had put in an appearance , and the chance of their doing so now seemed remote .
It evades capture by lodging itself inside the very muscles of the pursuer .
Rmirez-Snchez , tried in absentia , had evaded capture since the murders in Paris on June 27 , 1975 .
I had successfully evaded detection ; I had passed the terrible test of the measuring rod .
Remarkably , he was able to evade long term imprisonment , and made his way to the West .
